subject: [OT] Re: New FAQ item? (Re: [junit] Textui.TestRunner regarding)
msgSnippet: ... OT but that s what I do: I never, ever, ever work with the classpath.  I use Ant and set all my paths, jars one by one.  I can then work on the same
messageBody:
> How's this work for ya?

OT but that's what I do: I never, ever, ever work with the classpath. I
use Ant and set all my paths, jars one by one. I can then work on the
same project using different machines and OS. The informations
OS-related (location of the jar files) are specified in a property file,
included at the beginning of the Ant build script.

When I don't work with Ant, I write a script and explicitely specify all
classpath element in the command line.

If you really want to use the classpath, I suggest that you first try
running your program by specifying each classpath element in the java
command. Only when it works, include these elements into your classpath.

hth

-Vladimir

--
Vladimir Bossicard
